Virgo Framework Rendering Template

Create a route function

Instead of returning a Response(), return a render().

                    
# apps/home/routes.py

from virgo.core.routing import routes
from virgo.core.response import Response, redirect
from virgo.core.template import render


def home_page(request):
                    #template_name     #app_name
    return render("home_page.html", app="home")
routes["/"] = home_page

Inside the app's template folder, create home_page.html

                    
<!-- home/templates/home_page.html -->
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
<title>Document</title>
</head>
    <body>
        <h1>This is my Home Page</h1>         
    </body>
</html>
